2023 年 12 月 7 日星期四 12:08:12 +0000每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks TED - TED.com TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到 TED 演讲，这些演讲激发、激发和激发了一些世界领先的思想家和实干家的想象力，他们在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地的合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 TED 会议上值得传播的想法泰德TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到 TED 演讲，这些演讲激发、激发和激发了一些世界领先的思想家和实干家的想象力，他们在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地的合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 zh知识共享：https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/泰德contact@ted.com https://pl.tedcdn.com/rss_feed_images/ted_talks_main_podcast/video.png每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks 144 144 科学技术娱乐设计 TED、TEDTalks、TED 演讲、灵感、创造力、技术演示、教育不非成人的
如何在生活的荒谬中找到幽默|迈拉·卡尔曼迈拉·卡尔曼With levity and profound insight, artist Maira Kalman reflects on life, death, dinner parties, not knowing the right answers, the joys of eating a hot dog from a street vendor and more. This talk, interwoven with her delightful paintings, is itself an artwork that seems to hold the entirety of life in all its absurd glory.如何在生活的荒谬中找到幽默|迈拉·卡尔曼With levity and profound insight, artist Maira Kalman reflects on life, death, dinner parties, not knowing the right answers, the joys of eating a hot dog from a street vendor and more. This talk, interwoven with her delightful paintings, is itself an artwork that seems to hold the entirety of life in all its absurd glory. https://www.ted.com/talks/maira_kalman_how_to_find_humor_in_life_s_absurdity?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120171 120171 Wed, 06 Dec 2023 15:55:27 +0000高等教育不00:14:25泰德
如何阻止下一次大流行？停止砍伐森林|尼尔·沃拉尼尔·沃拉Clearing tropical forests isn't just dangerous to the natural world — it's also a threat to human health and wellbeing, says physician Neil Vora. Tracing how environmental devastation led to deadly epidemics like Ebola, he presents three ways deforestation unleashes disease and calls on each of us to help preserve the delicate ecological balance we depend upon.如何阻止下一次大流行？停止砍伐森林|尼尔·沃拉Clearing tropical forests isn't just dangerous to the natural world — it's also a threat to human health and wellbeing, says physician Neil Vora. 民主是有效的——我们只是需要更好的领导者林迪维·马兹布科林迪维·马兹布科South Africa transitioned to democracy in the 1990s with a visionary constitution, but the promises of that constitution are largely unfulfilled to this day. Public leader Lindiwe Mazibuko explores how poor leadership failed to deliver a better life for the country's citizens — and shares her mission to cultivate a new generation of ethical leaders who can revitalize democracy in South Africa and beyond.民主是有效的——我们只是需要更好的领导者林迪维·马兹布科South Africa transitioned to democracy in the 1990s with a visionary constitution, but the promises of that constitution are largely unfulfilled to this day. Public leader Lindiwe Mazibuko explores how poor leadership failed to deliver a better life for the country's citizens — and shares her mission to cultivate a new generation of ethical leaders who can revitalize democracy in South Africa and beyond. https://www.ted.com/talks/lindiwe_mazibuko_democracy_works_we_just_need_better_leaders?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120760 120760 Mon, 04 Dec 2023 16:04:00 +0000高等教育不00:12:16泰德
气候解决方案融资手册 |尼利·吉尔伯特和大卫·布拉德尼利·吉尔伯特和大卫·布拉德Tackling climate change costs a lot of money — and the financial sector is key to getting that money flowing. In a wide-ranging conversation, sustainable investment leaders Nili Gilbert and David Blood discuss where progress is being made on climate solutions, where capital still needs to move faster and why this is an unprecedented opportunity for sustainable growth.气候解决方案融资手册 |尼利·吉尔伯特和大卫·布拉德Tackling climate change costs a lot of money — and the financial sector is key to getting that money flowing. 如何为 100 亿人利用丰富的清洁能源 |胡利奥·弗里德曼胡利奥·弗里德曼We can produce abundant, sustainable and cheap energy — for everyone, says physicist Julio Friedmann. He explores the infrastructure, innovation and investment needed to supply energy to 10 billion people, offering case studies from Chile's refurbished supply chain, built in partnership with Japan, to Namibia's budding clean hydrogen production, inviting us to envision a greener, more equitably powered world.如何为 100 亿人利用丰富的清洁能源 |胡利奥·弗里德曼We can produce abundant, sustainable and cheap energy — for everyone, says physicist Julio Friedmann. 我们可以破解光合作用来养活世界吗？ |史蒂夫·朗史蒂夫·朗Photosynthesis is one of the most important processes on the planet, helping produce the food we eat and the air we breathe. Crop scientist Steve Long thinks it could be more efficient — and he's intent on giving it a boost. He shows how hacking photosynthesis could help feed the world all while reducing climate change.我们可以破解光合作用来养活世界吗？ |史蒂夫·朗Photosynthesis is one of the most important processes on the planet, helping produce the food we eat and the air we breathe. He shows how hacking photosynthesis could help feed the world all while reducing climate change. https://www.ted.com/talks/steve_long_can_we_hack_photosynthesis_to_feed_the_world?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120294 120294 Wed, 29 Nov 2023 15:50:30 +0000高等教育不00:11:07泰德
战争报道前线的生活|简·弗格森简·弗格森Covering global war stories can be hard and thankless — but it's critical work if the rest of us are to understand what's really going on in the world. For nearly two decades, journalist Jane Ferguson has reported on hostilities across Africa and the Middle East, and she's witnessed firsthand the changing face of her profession. Via stories of her own experiences at the heart of complex conflicts, she shares fascinating details of how she and other female colleagues have changed the way that news is captured, shared — and understood.战争报道前线的生活|简·弗格森Covering global war stories can be hard and thankless — but it's critical work if the rest of us are to understand what's really going on in the world. For nearly two decades, journalist Jane Ferguson has reported on hostilities across Africa and the Middle East, and she's witnessed firsthand the changing face of her profession. Via stories of her own experiences at the heart of complex conflicts, she shares fascinating details of how she and other female colleagues have changed the way that news is captured, shared — and understood. https://www.ted.com/talks/jane_ferguson_life_on_the_frontlines_of_war_reporting?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120677 120677 Tue, 28 Nov 2023 15:45:11 +0000高等教育不00:14:15泰德
疾病如何影响情绪背后的科学 |基莉·穆斯卡特尔基莉·穆斯卡特尔Your immune system is more socially aware than you think, says social neuroscientist and psychology professor Keely Muscatell. Investigating the interconnectedness of your mood and your inflammatory system, she offers an evolutionary reason as to why being sick may make you feel depressed — and vice versa.疾病如何影响情绪背后的科学 |基莉·穆斯卡特尔Your immune system is more socially aware than you think, says social neuroscientist and psychology professor Keely Muscatell. Investigating the interconnectedness of your mood and your inflammatory system, she offers an evolutionary reason as to why being sick may make you feel depressed — and vice versa. https://www.ted.com/talks/keely_muscatell_the_science_behind_how_sickness_shapes_your_mood?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120761 120761 Mon, 27 Nov 2023 15:58:10 +0000高等教育不00:13:51泰德
美国新一次大迁徙的案例|查尔斯·M·布洛查尔斯·M·布洛Social progress in the United States often seems to take two steps forward and one step back, with hard-fought civil rights wins countered by a seemingly inevitable backlash. In this spirited talk, writer Charles M. Blow makes the case that history, inverted, suggests a potential path forward. It's an unapologetically provocative proposal that Blow thinks just might spark a real shift toward equality in the US.美国新一次大迁徙的案例|查尔斯·M·布洛Social progress in the United States often seems to take two steps forward and one step back, with hard-fought civil rights wins countered by a seemingly inevitable backlash. 为什么你不应该相信无聊|凯文·加里凯文·加里Are you actually bored, or is something else going on? Educator Kevin H. Gary shares three practical takeaways to deal with the doldrums, so you can take control of your attention, figure out which feelings to trust and name the real problem.为什么你不应该相信无聊|凯文·加里Are you actually bored, or is something else going on? Educator Kevin H. 当拜登会见习近平时（以及美国和中国发生了什么）|伊恩·布雷默伊恩·布雷默US President Joe Biden and President of the People's Republic of China Xi Jinping recently met in San Francisco. It was the first time Xi had visited the US in six years — and the first time the two leaders had met in person in a year. Geopolitical expert Ian Bremmer explains the implications of the meeting, sharing context and insight on areas where the pair agree — and flagging key areas where tensions might yet arise. (This conversation with TED's Helen Walters was recorded on November 20, 2023.)当拜登会见习近平时（以及美国和中国发生了什么）|伊恩·布雷默US President Joe Biden and President of the People's Republic of China Xi Jinping recently met in San Francisco. It was the first time Xi had visited the US in six years — and the first time the two leaders had met in person in a year. Geopolitical expert Ian Bremmer explains the implications of the meeting, sharing context and insight on areas where the pair agree — and flagging key areas where tensions might yet arise. (This conversation with TED's Helen Walters was recorded on November 20, 2023.) https://www.ted.com/talks/ian_bremmer_when_biden_met_xi_and_what_s_going_on_with_the_us_and_china?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:120983 120983 Tue, 21 Nov 2023 16:10:12 +0000高等教育不00:42:55泰德
